newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech IPB confirms CZK 1.2 bln Q1-Q3 net. [corrected 10:55 gmt]
newsitem.headline: Czech IPB confirms CZK 1.2 bln Q1-Q3 net. [corrected 10:55 gmt]

text.p: Czech Investicni a Postovni Banka a.s. on Wednesday said its net profit for the first three quarters of the year totalled 1.2 billion crowns, "up 475 million crowns" from the nine month net result for 1995.
Spokesman Jan Rezek said in a statement that the bank expected full year 1996 net profit of 1.6 billion crowns, up from 1.127 billion crowns last year.
"For the first three quarters of this year, the bank created new reserves and provisions to cover credit risk in the amount exceeding two billion crowns," Rezek said.
The preliminary results were according to Czech accounting standards, he said.
Rezek said the entire IPB credit portfolio totalled 143 billion crowns at the end of September of which Czech crown credits granted totalled more than 131 billion.
Total deposits were 159 billion crowns. Comparative results for the same period in 1995 were not given.
Rezek said IPB was able to reduce the "total volume of so-called classified credit to 20 (Corrects from 12) percent" of the total "which is markedly below the average in the Czech banking sector".
